page.title: 17RELIGION IN DEERNESS
page.content: Almost all Orcadians in Deerness are {Church of Scotland.}Incomers of other denominations integrate well and join the choir on special occasions. The former Parish Church, St. Ninians with its surrounding{churchyard,}and the West Church, formerly Free, then United Free, are used on alternate Sundays. There are 132 members out of an adult population of 236. There is a {Sunday School and Woman's Guild.}In l974 Deerness became a{linked charge with the neighbouring parish of St. Andrews. In July 1985 a new minister was inducted, an unusual event in Deerness as his predecessor stayed 55 years and also had the distinction of being the last minister to be inducted into a Parish Church by the Presbytery of Kirkwall before the Union in 1929. {Communion Tokens}were replaced by cards as recently as 1981.
